Reviews.Title: “quiet and relaxing hotel away from hustle and bustle of venice”
Reviews.Author: Terry2727
Reviews.Content: Really nice personable hotel 2 minutes walk fro lido s.m.e. Close to nice restaurants and shops if not wanting to head over to venice. Rooms on the small side but absolutely spotless and breakfast had a great selection of pastries , cereal, bread,yoghurt e.t.c Overall a great experience and throughly enjoyed this small quaint hideaway from venice.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: AnnyDirk
Reviews.Content: Very nice, easy to find hotel on the island of Lido. Friendly staff, good breakfast. Quick and frequent vaporreto connections to the main island. Shower-cabins are on the small side, so if you are a "big" person, talking a morning shower could be quite an adventure ;-)

Reviews.Title: “mini break”
Reviews.Author: cazzieandco
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 days from December 6th till the 8th with 2 adults 2 teens and a 10 month old baby.All stayed in one room which was very spacious considering how many people was there.Was in room 20 which we found to be very accomodating and close to the dining room and reception.Was not expecting much from breakfast but was very pleasantly surprised ! nice selection of pastries,yogurts,cereals,rolls,eggs and the normal ham and cheese.Also when croissants etc was running low,they were quickly replenished.Ideal location for the beach in Lido and for the water buses to Venice.All in all,it was a very enjoyable stay and we will certainly stay at this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fernando84
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in Lido, only a short water taxi trip to Piazza San Marco. This is a good place to stay if you want to be close to the main tourist attractions but also value a quiet, relaxing area.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxing, and totally European.”
Reviews.Author: pshie
Reviews.Content: Here are some tips if you decide to stay at this hotel, which is excellent, by the way. 1. Take the water taxi to Lido... from the Venice train station, take taxi #51 (~40 minutes). 2. When you arrive, take a right out of the water taxi station and walk along the main street. It'll take around 8 minutes to get to the hotel, which is probably about the same if you take a taxi. Walk along the main street and cross a bridge. The second street on the left will be via Dandolo then take a left. The hotel will be on the right, a tall white building. 3. A few restaurants worth mentioning... Trattoria Andri (on via Lepanto) is an excellent restaurant that movie stars and locals frequent (take a right out of the hotel, cross a bridge, take a right onto via Lepanto, walk about 3 minutes and the restaurant is on the left). Restaurants at the end of the block from the hotel is good too (take a right out of the hotel, the restaurant is located on the left just after the bridge). The restaurant just before the bridge looks packed at night, probably good too. My review of the hotel... I had a great experience. The host was very friendly and was super helpful. We received a free upgrade to a bigger room, which included a little sitting room with a sofa. The bathroom is prototypical European, super tiny but functional. The breakfast was really good, quite a variety for such a small place. The location of the hotel is very good, only about a 8-10 minute walk from the water taxi station and 1-2 minutes from restaurants / main street. Very convenient but super quiet at night. The AC worked well. Free wifi was great. Lido Island is a 10 minute water taxi ride from Venice itself... It is quiet and seems to be more local... It is not packed wall to wall with tourists, which we loved. We didn't have enough time but I think exploring the entire Lido Island would be fun (local beach, fishing village).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: minkyjane
Reviews.Content: We stayed five night at this hotel and it was great. Deluxe room had plenty of room, ac worked well and there is charming tower for views of Venice. On top of all this it is an easy walk from the vaporetto and main street. The breakfast is okay but remember Venice ships in a lot of it's food so it is mostly packaged stuff - adequate though. And why would you want a heavy hot breakfast in this heat? Service was also great and reception is helpful. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, the location and the staff”
Reviews.Author: JaneinOttawa
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Venice and want a great stay, this is the place for you. Located on The Lido, a short vaporetta ride from the main part of Venice, this former private palace gives you the feel of staying in an authentic Venice palace but in a quiet, tree lined street within very easy walking distance to restaurants, stores (including Billa - the Italian grocery store where you can purchase wine, water, food, etc.) and the beach! Staying at the Villa Delle Palme you are staying in the middle of an upscale neighbourhood and you get the authentic Venice experience plus as beautiful as the main island is, it is great to escape the wall-to-wall tourists and take the vaporetta back to The Lido. Make sure you make the trip up to the roof top terrace for fantastic views and get the hotel staff's recommendations for some local restaurants. If you are going, buy the vaporetta pass for unlimited access for whatever period you choose. Also it is easy to get the water ferry (not water taxi unless you want to spend more money) from the airport to The Lido. (To the left when you exit the airport - all boats leave from the same location.)

Reviews.Title: “Faded grandeur - understated, but very nice”
Reviews.Author: A-non-o-mouse
Reviews.Content: We know (and love) Venice and on this visit back to the old country chose to stay in the Lido - as it's actually like being in Italy, with real locals, unlike Venice itself, which is a wonder of the world, great to visit, but very quiet at night and overrun by tourists by day. Loved the location on the Lido as itâ€™s right near the boat to St Marks. We had a very small room, it was booked for 3 adults to share (elderly parent and two grown up siblings), but one of us could not come - and that was a good thing! Apart from that, staff very nice, villa had great character, location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmolAZ
Reviews.Content: I liked this small buy lovely hotel. The staff was warm. They gave me a very good map of the city to use. Though it is on Lido I loved the location. Lido itself is a small and calm island with a public beach. The free internet was a bit slow but served my purpose. I liked the breakfast too. My room had a balcony though I did not use if because of the weather. The decoration was very pleasant. The only thing that bothered me is that my room was a bit too cold even after the heating.

Reviews.Title: “As good as ever”
Reviews.Author: AlisonCLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: I returned to this hotel for the 3rd time and having not been here for more than 3 years, was concerned it may have deteriorated. It was as lovely as I recall though! Among our arty were 2 disabled family members and I made sure at the time of booking that I mentioned this to Alberto & Stefano, the owners/managers. The 2 relatives concerned were given ground floor rooms so they didn't have to worry about the stairs (there is no lift), one of which has a huge bathroom with walk-in shower with seat, grab rails etc. All rooms are beautiful- some are smaller than others but the smaller rooms tend to have big balconies so you gain anyway. The showers are rather snug, as others have mentioned, but they do the job fine. Breakfast is standard Italian fare- rolls, croissants, cakes, boiled eggs, cereal, juice, coffee or tea, ham, cheese etc. One morning there were very few rolls as the delivery man hadn't turned up so we ate extra croissants- not a hardship! There's a little bar in the reception where you can get a drink or a cup of tea or coffee made for you. The tower at the very top of the hotel is a lovely place to sit and have a glass of prosecco whilst watching the sun setting. In fact, my other half was so carried away with the romance of the place that he proposed... of course i said yes! I really wouldn't stay anywhere else and personally, prefer the Lido to staying on Venice as the boat trip over to St Marks is such a pleasure in itself. I always feel safe walking around Lido, even late at night & there are some reasonably priced bars and restaurants which are really lovely. The beach is lovely too!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMountaingoat
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Villa Delle Palme. Two flight of stairs to our room (reasonable size), and clean and the staff very helpful. The hotel is located in a quiet street not far from the water bus port and Lido was a good choice as we enjoyed catching the ferry into Venice.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but good value”
Reviews.Author: Churtal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Villa Delle Palme for 4 nights in May...the hotel from the exterior looks a little tired than the hotel's official photos, but most hotels do. Located in a quiet residential street. We were allocated a ground floor room (21)...but we did request a high floor. The staff were welcoming and friendly. The room was small and the bathroom very small only had a shower cubical which was tiny....didn't realise they made shower cubicles soooooooo small. Shower was satisfactory always hot water. There was noise heard from staff preparing breakfast...which was disturbing. The room was cleaned to a good standard...rooms a little dated...they have tried to acquire the venetian style. But not quiet attained it. Sheets crisp and white towel clean but a bit on the thin side. We have previously stayed on Venice Island on the Grand Canal and payed allot more but was far more superior but then again allot more expensive. Breakfast room was small but well formed very clean...the breakfast was satisfactory no hot food, cereal and ham and cheese, yogurts, cake etc. but filling and good quality There is a hair dryer...no tea or coffee making facilities. The bed and pillows were hard to our liking but that's a personal choice. The room safe was broken so we had to use the hotels safe (both are free) not a problem The AC/Heating did not work or turned off but it was OK for this time of year. View from the top of the tower well worth the stair climb No lift. Probably not suited for wheelchair/disabled at 10-12 steps into the front property Overall a good no frills hotel...not far from the vappertte boat stop....clean and friendly would recommend this hotel to others if on a low/medium budget and just need a base for sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Run away. We moved to a different Hotel, even though we had to pay for the 3 nights we blew off.”
Reviews.Author: Badams_iyns
Reviews.Content: When towels get threadbare, you could replace them. Or, like this Hotel, PATCH THEM! I kid you not! We were scheduled to stay 5 nights. Europe is big on using shower towels for a couple days in a row, so our habit at all the locations we stayed at, was to get clean towels every other day. They say if you throw the towel on the floor they'll replace it with a clean one, otherwise hang it up. I tossed my towel on the floor after using it twice, and when we got back that evening the towel HAD to be the same one, all folded up and placed on the rack as if it were clean. When you see a thread bear towel with patches over holes, you just know if it's the same one. And they picked it up off the floor and acted as if it were washed? I mean come on, what are the chances of getting the same towel? The bed was hard as a rock. I like a firm bed, but this was bad. No box spring, just a very firm mattress on a frame with slats of wood to hold it up. Next, it was October, not exactly the hottest time of the year, but since the sun beat on the windows from the west all afternoon the room was still stifling when we got back after 10 pm. The AC couldn't get the room any cooler than 84 degrees, and that by morning! (29 Celsius) We tried to open the windows and let the evening breeze in, but the neighbors had a dog barking ALL night long, and we were awakened each time someone up stairs used water. You'll have to take a water bus to and from the main islands. We knew that going in, but the place looked so cute, we thought it would be worth it. We got up at 8:00 am the first day there and ordered some Cafe Americano, hot. We left at 10:00 am to go find our own coffee! The staff could not have been any less helpful if they tried. Their recommendations for restaurants were terrible and by then I was so fed up that I was suspicious the restaurant owners were friends of theirs. I'd tell my ex wife to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, classy, verging on old world elegance”
Reviews.Author: Rosenzwerg
Reviews.Content: The location on Lido was both a blessing and a curse. This was a nice escape from the heaving masses of Venice, though the 20 minute vaporetto ride over to Lido in the peak of summer about killed us. The hotel has a lovely reception area, nice, comfortable rooms, great air cond, and functional bathrooms. There is no discernible elevator, so the place would not be disabled friendly as most, if not all rooms are at least one floor above. The beds were firm but not painful. We sat in the tower at night in the cool evening and surveyed Venice, it was like we had the place to ourselves. The breakfast was unremarkable, standard cereal, bread and coffee/tea.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Lorelle1313
Reviews.Content: It looks just like the pictures! Beautiful and clean! Very romantic. It was a little small and even though our room was right off the lobby it was still very quiet! There is a small elecant dinning room off the lobby where they have a very nice breakfast in the morning. Would defanitly recommend, esp to couples! It was a short walk in either direction to the water taxi's and short walk in the other direction to the center of the island with plenty of nice resturants!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful building, good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 1gruesome
Reviews.Content: To my mind Villa delle Palma provides good accommodation at an excellent price. The hotel is in a grand house complete with tower which you can climb. There are always pros and cons in staying outside Venice itself but for us the Lido provided a break from the melee of Venice. My room although smallish had a balcony which was great for sitting out. My friends room was considerably larger but no balcony - you take your pick. Can't really fault it, the staff were excellent and helpful. It is only a 5 minute walk from the port.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in Lido”
Reviews.Author: Finnatic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Venice for a week for performances, and decided to cap off the trip with 2 days in Lido to celebrate our anniversary. We were quite pleased with this hotel -- for starters, the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially at the front desk and breakfast room. We loved the rooftop terrace and our room came with its own private balcony as well. Those on here who complained about the smallness of the bathrooms (in general) probably have never been to Europe before. We loved the quiet area which was so close to downtown Lido, and really enjoyed strolling the streets, The concierge even recommended a restaurant for us and booked the cab as well, which was great. The breakfasts were really nice and the eating room quite pleasant. We were totally satisfied with out stay and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “"Not as good as expected"”
Reviews.Author: Radiolina
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Villa delle Palme last week-end, and must say that I was somewhat disappointed...I was very confident when I made the reservation, because of the various good reviews I read here, however there are two aspects of Villa delle Palme I did not enjoy. First let me say that it is truw that the hotel is located in a quiet place, near to the Vaporetto stop, the room we had was indeed clean, and the size was ok. One thing which was not specified in the bookng was that the "standard" double room we booked was not "standard", since it had a bathroom for people with special needs, which made it less confortable for us to use...I asked for a room change but it was obviously impossible, because the hotel was fully booked, so the receptionist told us. The breakfast is another negative point: we arrived at 9.40, serving stopped at 10.30 on Sunday, when we got there (we weren't the last guests), the bread had finished, there 2 slices left of salami and cheese for the savoury things, and only a couple of croissants. We asked the only person who was doing the breakfast service for some bread, she first said she was sorry but they didn't have any anymore. When we clearly showed big disappointment and surprise (well maybe indignation), she asked for a few minutes, after that she came back with 4 small panini, which had gone from freezer to oven. In the meantime another couple of guests had arrived, and decided to recycle coffee, tea, and even a croissant leftover from other tables, since noone was there to attend them! They definitely need more people to work there, and more food for breakfast, where the overall choice was rather limited. Considering the prices in Venice, what we paid (80â‚¬ for 1 night) was still ok, but I was disappointed...and think the ranking here is way too high!

Reviews.Title: “Donâ€™t bother â€“ try somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: dissapointed_00
Reviews.Content: We booked here for a long weekend for my girlfriends birthday. They seemed very helpful to upgrade us to the best room available when explained it was a special occasion. However, for the amount we spent (145 Euro a night) the hotel and service was a huge disappointment. We saw some feedback from others that it was quite noisy from other rooms and staff, especially on the ground floor, so we specifically asked for a 1st floor room â€“ this doesnâ€™t make a difference by the way â€“their website says soundproof walls â€“ that is definitely not the case - so if you enjoy listening to other peoples conversations and them going to the toilet then this is the hotel for you! The room was small and the bathroom even smaller â€“ sorry, a bathroom implies there is a bath â€“ there isnâ€™t â€“ there is a shower of which I have seen better quality in a YMCA! (Remember we are supposed to be in their best room available!) When we asked for an iron in the morning, we were advised for health and safety they do not have them (OK, fine) so to leave them on the bed. When we said we needed to iron the clothes we wanted to wear that day they were very grumpy and said to bring them down and they would get them done. We then left a couple of items on our beds for our evening clothes. On return they were done â€“ great! On checking out however, we had been charged 18Euro for ironing â€“ when we complained about this and said they should have told us there would be a charge, their response was we should have asked and everywhere in Europe is the same!!!!! For breakfast we had to wait for a table â€“ in the end it took so long, we went back to our room and came down later. The breakfast was not very good at all â€“ if you like cold boiled eggs â€“ you will be fine! Their entry card system that worked the door and the electricity inside seemed to have a mind of its own and would intermittently start and stop working. The website says satellite TV â€“ this is a little misleading, as the only English speaking channel available was CNN â€“ great, just what you want to chill out to, depressing news over and over again on the credit crunch! Venice is amazing â€“ beautiful â€“ my advice, try and pay a little more â€“ or find a better 3 star hotel somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but small rooms/bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: mb0008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in October but our three night stay was immediately shortened to two nights as even though we'd booked and confirmed our stay through easytobook.com I got a separate email from the hotel management to say that they were fully booked for our first night but that they had been able to book us into a similar hotel across the road. When we arrived we were disappointed to see that the hotel opposite was by no means as nice as the villa del palme and although we paid the same amount per night we were offered the parking for free which saved us 15 euros i think! Small consolation really! When we finally got into the villa itself we found the rooms small but clean and the bathroom absolutely tiny - the last reviewer is right; in the shower you cannot bend down to pick up the soap or you open the door! The breakfast/dining area was incredibly small too and the continental brekkie just OK - this hotel was obviously someones house originally. Saying that overall it is a nice and clean hotel, perfect location as a very short walk to the ferrys and amazing views from the rooftop of the whole of venice across the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmawales83
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week with my fiance for my birthday. The location was great, on the Lido which is quieter then Venice proper. The hotel itself was quite small, we stayed in the disabled room (I think it was the last one left) which was huge, especially the bathroom. The staff were helpful and the breakfast was lovely. The room was a little noisey but this did not really bother us as we are heavy sleepers and we have been advised most hotels in Venice have a little noise. Mostly a lovely stay, within 5 mins of Venice centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice reception...not clean enough”
Reviews.Author: lickman99
Reviews.Content: It is a small 3 stars hotel in Lido. For location, it is not far...only walk 5 mins to the pier and 10 mins to St. Mark. It is a quite place and easy to find. Our room is on the ground floor. The decoration is new and overall tidy. We've been to different cities in Italy which is the most nice person in reception. Other staff is also nice. The place for breakfast is classic euorpean style. We like it. For the disadvantages, we think it is not clean enough. We found pieces of sand and dust in the bed sheet. Also, the staff is not careful enough. We found a glasses in the room which may belong to the previous guests, I guess. We feel a bit strength becoz the room is facilited for disabled. Overall rating should be slightly better than average. In Venice, the rate is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KLAMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 3 nights there in May and enjoyed it greatly. Stefano and the staff were very helpful, the Hotel web site directions made it very easy to locate. For those who want some peace and quiet after a day in busy Venice, this is the place. Lido island is a ferry ride away from the main island, but it's worth the trouble if you want to have a good night's sleep. Make sure you get the number 52 ferry from the train station to minimize travel time, otherwise get the no. 1 ferry if you wish to see the Grand Canal along the way. We particularly enjoyed the gardens and hearty breakfast, and the rooftop terrace which affords a good view over the canals. A glass of wine in the garden after a day of exploring Venice was very enjoyable. Numerous shops and restaurants are a short stroll away, as is the beach. Check the room you have booked before you go, and that it has space around the bed. Some rooms are a bit small, but most are quite reasonable and are well appointed. I recommend it, and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Villa delle Palme”
Reviews.Author: A_B_82
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights to Villa delle Palme from their website. The hotel is situated near the waterfront, so in 2 minutes you can take the boats to go around Venice. My first impression at the arrival was really positive. The man at the reception was very polite and took us to our room. I suppose this hotel was an house in the past. It has a really quite and elegant atmosphere. The interior decorations are perfect, the dining room is small but very polished. On the roof there is a balcony were you can go and have a beautiful view of Lido and, at the horizon, Venice. Our room (a superior-type) was at the highest floor. Very clean in every corner, not so large but with a big sofa other than bed and a wide beautiful bathroom. The other occupants of the hotel were nice and quite people and during the night there was no noise at all from other rooms. The breakfast buffet was well assorted, regarding both drinks (hot/cold milk, coffee, chocolate, fruit juices, etc.) and food (biscuits, croissants, cakes, eggs, bread, yogurt, etc.) We'd already stayed to Lido in another hotel and we're sure Villa delle Palme is the best choice. We'll surely stay there again. I definitely recommend this hotel for its high quality and small prices.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: km_77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Villa Delle Palme in 12/06. The room was fantastic (loved the Venetian textile 'wallpaper') and the service was excellent. Breakfast was nothing to write home about (cold buffet) but adequate nevertheless. The hotel is only a 5 min walk to the Valparetto, which takes around 15 mins to St Marks Square. The weather in December made the journey quite arduous at times but I would imagine its a rather nicer experience during summer. The hotel is a excellent value for money if you don`t mind staying a short boat ride away from the main island...

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for Villa Delle Palme”
Reviews.Author: GreyKitten
Reviews.Content: Totally enjoyable stay at this lovely hotel. Very convenient situation for Vaporetto piers. Arrived really late by boat from airport and had no trouble finding hotel - 5 mins. walk. Everything very clean, beds comfortable, shower worked fine, no complaints at all. Breakfast was good and everything fresh and well presented. Special compliments to the young lady who serves tea/coffee - very friendly and helpful. All hotel staff very pleasant. No hesitation in recommending Villa Delle Plame. However, if you go out for a meal on Lido I suggest you avoid Ristorante Alla Botte, Gran Viale, unless you want a very disappointing dining experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Best accommodation of the Big 3”
Reviews.Author: Maddietravel
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Big 3: Rome, Venice, Florence, plus a small town in central Italy. Interestingly, we paid the same price at each location: 85 Euros per night. Only in Venice and in the small town did we receive both a private bath and an included breakfast for that price. VIlla Della Palme wins the contest though, as service was thorough and friendly, and the hotel is away from the throngs of tourists (this would not be the case in summer, though!)

Reviews.Title: “Good for budget!”
Reviews.Author: OUswilson
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Near the water taxi dock, about a 5-10 minute walk. Quiet neighborhood, felt safe. About a 20 minute water taxi to main islands. The internet usage was pricey, but you can purchase by the hour. Has an awesome rooftop balcony where you can experience an amazing sunset over Venice! Near shops and cafes. Quaint breakfeast room with free continental.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gaelic999
Reviews.Content: This was a superb hotel, just a short vaperetto ride from the Grand Canal. We arrived in Venice by train. As you descend the steps from the train station, you realise you have arrive somewhere very special. Ahead of you is the Grand Canal with its beautiful palaces and boats. We got the vaperetto to the Lido, takes about 20 mins and then the hotel is 2 minutes from the vaparetto stop on the Lido. We received a very warm welcome at the hotel and were shown straight up to our room. The room was quite small, but had a lovely terrace with sun loungers and table, which was a lovely surprise. We also had a bottle of Prosecco chilling, with the managers compliments. The bathroom was absolutely fine, but the shower cubical was quite small!! Breakfast was superb, with cheeses, meats, rolls, fresh fruit juices, teas, coffee etc. If you have time take a walk down the main street and head for the beach. The beach was amazing and very quiet when we visited. Lots of local shops just 2 mins away, for picnic supplies. We would thoroughy recommend staying on the Lido. You can escape the throng of tourists and you have the most amazing boat ride, morning and night as you head into the grand canal and then back to your hotel. We bought a 3 day vaparetto pass which was amazing value. Chow Venice the book has been mentioned before, and we managed to get it on Amazon. This is full of lovely traditional restaurants, away from the hustle and bustle and serving traditional italian food. An afternoon trip to Merano is also worthwhile. We just picked up a vaparetto from Arsenal. We loved Venice - it is an amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and elegant”
Reviews.Author: szabolcs17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Villa delle Palme with my fiancee shortly after the Carnival. This meant that we got low season rates so I ended up paying 58EUR/night for a double with breakfast. This hotel - especially at this price - was an excellent choice. It is housed in a beautiful turn of the century mansion and has great atmosphere. Our room was very nicely decorated with a Venetian touch and with the exception of the bathroom door not opening perfectly due to the bed being too close, it didn't feel crammed. Breakfast was very good, much better than what is usually given at this price range in Italy. Besides the omnipresent pre-packaged sweet pastries, there was fresh cheese and cold cuts, cereals, yoghurt, plus fresh and hot croissant (yum). I was a little concerned about the location as the hotel is on Lido. However, my worries were ill-founded as it was just a 10 minute vaporetto ride from San Marco followed by a less than 5 minute walk to Villa delle Palme. Prices go up extremely during the summer, which I find somewhat unreasonable, but this is Venice after all. High season means high prices.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant time”
Reviews.Author: candjd
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel. The bedroom was beautifully decorated albeit small (as we had expected as we were on a budget) but it did have a nice ensuite bathroom. Everything was wonderfully clean and we found that its location was at an easy distance from the centre of Venice and thankfully very easy to find when we disembarked at Lido. No need to employ a taxi! Self-service breakfast was very good with a selection of croissants/bread/cheese/ham/yoghurt/cererals/other cakes etc. The owner and staff were pleasant and helpful and spoke great English and reccommended a nice family restaurant which serves amazing enormous melt in your mouth fillet steaks! I think the restaurant was called Africa.The hotel desk seems to be open all evening so no worries about what time one must return. All in all a lovely holiday and I would certainly reccommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful- don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: AlisonCLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: We searched the web for hotels and saw this one which looked nice and was vey reasonably priced. I checked existing reviews and they also were very good generally, so I booked it and am delighted that I did. We prefer staying on the Lido as it's quieter and less frenetic than Venice itself and is a lovely place to walk around too. The hotel is very close to the main Vaporetto stop- just a few minutes' walk. It's a stunning looking building and inside, the rooms are spotlessly clean & beautifully decorated. Having read other reviews, which mentioned that the rooms and particularly the showers, were very small, I was a little concerned, but needn't have worried. The bedroom was perfectly adequately sized and the bathroom seemed huge! The shower was fine too, so no worries there. We were in one of the ground-floor rooms, near reception, but didn't experience any problems with noise as other visitors have mentioned. The breakfast room is lovely. Again, it's beautifully decorated and clean and the breakfast was more than adequate. Some reviewers on this and other sites, had commented that only croissants, cake and jam were on offer. Whether the owner has taken this criticism on board, or whether he's just changed his menu, I don't know, but now you can choose cereals, yoghurt, bread rolls, cheese, hams, croissants, etc, plus tea, coffee & fruit juice. You can eat as much as you like. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, recommending places to eat and things to visit. There's a wonderful tower on top of the hotel and I strongly suggest that you borrow the key from reception and go up for a look. The view of Venice and the Lido is stunning and it makes an ideal spot to take pictures or just to sit and relax. On the morning we checked-out, we mentioned to the owner that we weren't due to fly home until later that evening and he very kindly offered to keep our luggage at the hotel so that we could spend the rest of the day walking around Venice without having to lug our bags around. With regard to previous comments about security, there was one occasion when we went back to the hotel after an evening meal and found nobody on the reception desk. I agree that this could be a cause for concern but feel that on the whole, as the desk was manned almost constantly and the crime rate in Venice is so low, it's probably less of an issue than in many other areas! I would definately recommend this hotel and am already planning another trip back later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Impressed”
Reviews.Author: coffeyb6
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights here in January. I chose this hotel based on its good reviews.The first day we arrived there was nobody at the reception and we had to wait around for about twenty minutes to check in. I had paid top price for a double superior room and we were checked into a room directly beside the reception. When i questioned this I was told that's what I would get for what I paid, even though the two rooms with balconies were free upstairs. The reception was unmanned most of the time we were there. We were woken by the phone in the reception ringing and also by the guests upstairs whenever they used the bathroom...no soundproof walls! The worst part was that on our final day we were waiting to check out and as usual there was nobody on reception we ended up having to search the hotel for a member of staff and eventually found someone in the basement after about twenty minutes of searching and three knocks on the door of the room he was in. This resulted in us missing the boat we had planned to get and almost missing our flight. In general the hotel is nice, the room was okay for 65 euro a night but i would expect their superior room to have something extra. It is very clean and when you can get a hold of some staff members they are reasonaby friendly. However travelling to venice in the winter is not ideal for younger people as the population is a bit older so there are no bars open until the summer. The staff could not recommend anywhere for us to go at night time.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the soundproofing?”
Reviews.Author: Kopstamp
Reviews.Content: Quaint hotel and good location on Lido with a good view from the roof terrace. Friendly and helpful staff, however....My wife and I were looking for a small quiet hotel for our stay in Venice. We stayed in the french 2pax room which by the way is tiny (practically a small double bed, small desk and wardrobe with not much other space). The first night we tried to get to bed early (around 10pm), but because of the poor soundproofing between rooms it was interrupted by listening to your neighbours going to the toilet, using the hairdryer, closing the shower door and voices - from all sides and above. Needless to say we were woken every so often until everyone was in bed sleeping. This is not what you expect from a "3" star hotel. The second and third evening were a repeat. All in all we did not get the ideal rest you would expect. Additionally the bed was not great quality and the blackout would still let light in. If you want a quiet and peaceful hotel, I do not recommend this one. Tips for Venice: Buy the tourist 72hour ticket for the Vaporetta, if you're staying for at least 3 days (25 EUR). For a slower but interesting trip to Lido (should you stay there) take the number 1, through the grand canal on to Lido. For quick trips from Lido take the LN (direct to San Marco Piazza). If you would like to go to the free beach in Lido go to the opposite side of the Vaporetta stop and walk down the main road. It will also be worth hiring bicycles for a fun ride around Lido (nice and flat).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Karla
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 7-night stay at this lovely hotel on the Lido, in Venice. It is a small (11 rooms) 3-star hotel but feels like a 4-star. The hotel is an art deco villa with a beautiful garden (bordered by tall palm trees, hence the name). It is located a 5-minute walk to the main waterbus (vaporetti) stop for the Lido from where numerous lines will take you to San Marco (in 10 minutes) and other parts of the lagoon (for example, direct to Burano which is lovely, and also connects to Torcello, another 'must-see'). The hotel only offers breakfast and no room service, but has a well-stocked reasonbly priced mini bar, an internet facility and a wonderful 3-tier roof terrace with stunning panoramic views. We had a deluxe double which was spacious and comfortable. The interior is very fresh (no worn carpets / furniture) and very well-maintained. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and happy to arrange events (you can buy tickets for nightly Vivaldi etc concerts in one of the churches through reception, at no extra charge). We loved coming back to the Lido and the hotel to recharge our batteries for a siesta and at night! We also recommend the Hotel Villa Laguna, the first place next to the vaperetti stop on your way to Villa della Palme, for a bellini before dinner - they have a lovely garden with stunning views to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sparklysparky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights of part of our 14 day honeymoon and absolutely adored this hotel. It is easy to find and just a boat ride away from the main part of Venice. After booking this hotel using an internet website, someone emailed me right away and gave me all the information I needed on how to find them upon arrival and offered help on figuring out exactly what we were going to do while staying in Venice. This is far beyond what we expected from any hotel and the absolute best service we received from any of the hotels we booked during our 2 week honeymoon. The hotel itself is very charming and the rooms are beautiful. They are a great size as far as European standards go. The shower was a bit small but my husband fit in it, so we were fine. We also had a large patio area connected to our room, which was nice as well. You can go to the very top of the hotel and see Venice and catch a breathtaking view of all that surrounds this hotel. We have already decided that we will go back in 2016 to renew our vows and stay at the exact same hotel we honeymooned in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: manteray1
Reviews.Content: As an avid reader of Trip Advisor, this is the first time I have felt compelled to write a review of somewhere we have stayed as a result of advice given. The Villa Delle Palma lived up to all our expectations, which were high given the previous reviews. There were seven of us, four adults and three teenagers, staying in one triple and one quadruple room, which although not large, were very comfortable with good facilties. We were fortunate to have room 28 which has the only balcony, which was lovely. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and dealt well with our inability to speak Italian. We borrowed the key for the staircase to the tower and have great photographs of the view from there. The only word of warning I would give is that the shower was a bit of an adventure for "plus size" guests, I'll take my shoe horn next time! The hotel building is charming and in a lovely neighbourhood, we were pleasantly suprised by the Lido which has good shopping, bars, restaurants etc and is a welcome break from the more crowded areas of Venice. The Vaporetto trip to San Marco is only about 15 minutes with the hotel only about 5 minutes walk to the nearest stop, this became a part of the holiday that we really enjoyed. This was our first trip to Venice but hopefully not our last, and we will certainly be returning to the Villa Delle Palma if we are fortunate to go back to this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Hospitality at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Babs42
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Venice and we found Villa delle palme without any problems....it was a lovely waterbus journey down to the Lido which enhanced the day when visiting anywhere. What a treat the Villa was..lovely plush venetian room...our only comments would be that it would have been good to have two pillows each and maybe tea/coffee making facilities in the room...but these are only minor comments. The staff were friendly and hospitable and it was lovely to stay in a smaller villa as opposed to a larger hotel as this Villa was more intimate and gave it a more personal feeling and oh my goodness...what views from the roof top tower, absolutely amazing and beautiful...we will definately be staying at the Villa Delle Palme again on our next visit to Venice.

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Delle Palme
HotelInfo.Address: Via Dandolo 12/A - Lido, 30126 Venice, Italy
